homepageabout.title: Hematite Infotech
homepageabout.description1: Hematite Infotech Pvt. Ltd. is an organization dedicated to the spread of IT Education. Ever since its inception in 2017, the Academy has fulfilled its goals of providing Quality Computer Education, transforming aspiring students into tomorrowâ€™s IT professionals. Hematite Infotech has continuously upgraded its performance, creating a focus on advanced information technologies, high-end academics, and training.The center has modern infrastructure, including corporate-standard laboratories equipped with the latest state-of-the-art technologies. We are proud to remain associated with the best faculty in the industry etc.
homepageabout.description2: We also have a well-equipped library with a wide array of manuals. We also provide placement assistance to our students. Hematite Infotech has had an enviable placement record since its inception.

services.title: Application Development
services.description: Our IT training programs are designed to equip individuals with the necessary skills and knowledge to excel in these specialized areas of programming. With a focus on hands-on learning and practical application, our courses cover the latest industry trends and technologies, allowing participants to stay ahead in this rapidly evolving field. Whether you are a beginner or an experienced professional, our comprehensive training programs can help you enhance your proficiency and achieve your career goals in IT development.

services.title: IT Training
services.description: Our comprehensive IT training programs cover a wide range of in-demand skills and technologies. Whether you're interested in mastering DevOps methodologies, becoming a proficient web developer, or delving into the world of Artificial Intelligence with Python and Machine Learning, we have the courses to suit your needs. Additionally, we offer training in Mobile App Development for both Android and iOS platforms, as well as expertise in ASP.NET, Java (Core + Advanced), software testing, cloud computing, CCNA networking, and effective business communication strategies

services.title: IT Consulting
services.description: Hematite Consultants advises on the technology enablement, Application security and process enablement for Organizations. Our specialized consultants help minimize the cost and time associated transformative changes in the business of IT. Primary client offerings include Management Consulting, IT Strategic Services, Project Leadership, Data Analytics, and Information Management, Application security consultants, Network engineers, Software Technology consultants.

contact.address: Pune : 2nd Floor, Mathura Nagar Housing Society, Near Janseva Sahakari Bank Chandan Nagar, Kharadi, Pune - 411014.

placementDescription: Hematite Infotech Pvt. Ltd. is an organization dedicated to the spread of IT Education. Ever since its inception in 2017, the Academy has fulfilled its goals of providing Quality Computer Education, transforming aspiring students into tomorrow's IT professionals. Hematite Infotech has continuously upgraded its performance, creating a focus on advanced information technologies, high-end academics, and training.

The center has modern infrastructure, including corporate-standard laboratories equipped with the latest state-of-the-art technologies. We are proud to remain associated with the best faculty in the industry. Besides lectures from experts and visiting faculty, we also organize video-based sessions, seminars, assignments, internships, projects, faculty-student discussions, expert talks and profiling of the students, guidance in hackathons, Start-ups, etc. We also have a well-equipped library with a wide array of manuals. We also provide placement assistance to our students. Hematite Infotech has had an enviable placement record since its inception.

contents: Fundamental principles and methodologies of graphic design.
Techniques for creating compelling visual content using color theory, typography, and composition.
Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite tools: CorelDraw, Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign.
Designing for different media: print, web, and mobile.
Basics of branding and visual identity.
Understanding and applying design thinking in projects.
No prior knowledge about graphic design required.
Basic computer skills.

description: Graphic design is the art and practice of planning and projecting ideas and experiences with visual and textual content. This course covers a range of design disciplines and focuses on how to communicate ideas visually, how to develop a design process, and how to use different design tools and software effectively. The course aims to help learners develop the skills necessary to create visually appealing designs that meet professional standards.

contents.title: Introduction to Graphic Design
contents.description: Understanding the role and importance of graphic design in various fields.

contents.title: CorelDraw
contents.description: Creating vector graphics, logos, and illustrations.

contents.title: Design Principles
contents.description: Learning the core principles of design such as balance, contrast, alignment, repetition, and proximity.

contents.title: Color Theory
contents.description: Exploring the psychological effects of colors and how to use them effectively in design.

contents.title: Typography
contents.description: Understanding typefaces, fonts, and how to create readable and aesthetically pleasing text layouts.

contents.title: Adobe Photoshop
contents.description: Basic and advanced photo editing techniques, working with layers, masks, and filters.

contents.title: Adobe Illustrator
contents.description: Creating vector graphics, logos, and illustrations.

contents.title: Adobe InDesign
contents.description: Designing layouts for print and digital publications.

contents.title: Branding and Visual Identity
contents.description: Creating logos, brand guidelines, and visual identities that communicate the brand message.

contents.title: Portfolio Development
contents.description: Compiling and presenting a professional design portfolio.

contents: People who want to begin a new career in graphic design.
Individuals looking to learn graphic design from scratch.
Marketing and communication professionals who want to add design skills to their toolkit.
Freelancers looking to enhance their design skills and offer more services to clients.
Artists and creative professionals who want to explore the digital side of design.
Learn Django basics, including project creation, model understanding, migrations, and local server deployment.
Implement a full Models-Views-Templates structure for your site
Handle form submission POST requests and save data to the database.
Implement authentication and authorization in Django web applications.
Construct REST APIs using Django Rest Framework.
Fundamentals of SQL including syntax, keywords, and statements.
Principles of database design, normalization, and entity-relationship modeling.
Operations like inserting, updating, deleting, and querying data in MySQL tables.
Writing complex SQL queries with joins, subqueries, and aggregate functions.
Basic Python and web development knowledge (HTML/CSS).
No prior Django experience necessary.

courseDescription.title: Course Description
description: Django is a Python web framework known for its rapid development and pragmatic design. It simplifies web app development with features like URL routing, database management, form handling, and template rendering.

Django REST Framework (DRF) extends Django's capabilities to create robust APIs, offering tools for data serialization, authentication, permissions, and viewsets, catering to web and mobile app needs. It's a key tool for developing modern web applications with Django and Python.

MySQL is a widely used relational database management system (RDBMS) that seamlessly integrates with Django, a high-level Python web framework. Django provides built-in support for MySQL, allowing developers to efficiently create web applications that interact with MySQL databases.

contents.title: Introduction
contents.description: Overview of Python, its features, and internal workings.

contents.title: Variables & Keywords
contents.description: Understanding variables, naming conventions, and Python keywords.

contents.title: Data Types
contents.description: Exploring built-in data types like numeric, string, list, tuple, dictionary, and set.

contents.title: Operators
contents.description: Overview of arithmetic, comparison, logical, and bitwise operators.

contents.title: Control Flow
contents.description: Conditional statements (if, elif) and loops (for, while) for decision-making and iteration.

contents.title: Functions & Recursion
contents.description: Defining, calling functions, function arguments, inner calling techniques, lambda functions, and recursive functions.

contents.title: Input Handling
contents.description: Managing dynamic input in lists using list comprehension and the input() function.

contents.title: Object-Oriented Programming (OOP)
contents.description: Introduction to classes, objects, inheritance, polymorphism, and encapsulation.

contents.title: Decorators & Concurrency
contents.description: Understanding decorators to enhance functions and methods, and working with multiprocessing and multithreading for concurrency.

contents.title: Introduction to RDBMS
contents.description: Understand the fundamentals of Relational Database Management Systems.

contents.title: Installation of MySQL
contents.description: Learn how to install and set up MySQL on your system.

contents.title: Data Retrieval
contents.description: Master the SELECT statement for retrieving data from tables.

contents.title: Data Manipulation
contents.description: Explore techniques for adding and modifying data with INSERT INTO and UPDATE statements.

contents.title: Advanced Operations
contents.description: Gain proficiency in list filtering (IN & NOT IN), sorting (ORDER BY), joins (INNER, LEFT, RIGHT), union operations, aggregate functions (SUM, ROUND, GROUP BY, HAVING), database and table management (CREATE, DROP, ALTER), constraints, date handling, SQL data types, and MySQL functions.

contents.title: Basics of NoSQL Databases
contents.description: Learn the fundamental concepts of NoSQL databases, highlighting the differences from traditional SQL databases.

contents.title: Installation and Setup
contents.description: Guide through installing MongoDB and setting up the development environment.

contents.title: Data Modeling
contents.description: Understand how to design and manage data structures using collections and documents.

contents.title: CRUD Operations
contents.description: Perform Create, Read, Update, and Delete operations in MongoDB.

contents.title: Mongoose
contents.description: Learn how to use Mongoose, an ODM (Object Data Modeling) library, to interact with MongoDB in a Node.js application for schema definition, data validation, and query building.

contents.title: Introduction & Installation
contents.description: Basics and installing Django.

contents.title: URLs & Views
contents.description: Routing URLs to views.

contents.title: Redirects & Reverse
contents.description: Handling redirects and generating URLs dynamically.

contents.title: Templates & Static Files
contents.description: Preparing and rendering templates, managing templates and static files.

contents.title: Styling & Static URLs
contents.description: Adding CSS styling and dynamic static URLs.

contents.title: Data & Models
contents.description: Defining models, managing migrations and working with data and database options.

contents.title: Data Operations
contents.description: Inserting, updating, querying, and filtering data.

contents.title: Admin & Relationships
contents.description: Using the admin interface and defining model relationships.

contents.title: Forms & Class Views
contents.description: Implementing forms and views using classes.

contents.title: File Uploads & REST API
contents.description: Handling file uploads and using Django Rest Framework for APIs.

contents: Anyone interested in learning website development with Python.
Intermediate programmers who already have some understanding of Python and want to skill up.
Developers interested in understanding how to create and manage APIs.
Understand the correct syntax of Python language elements like indentation, loops, conditionals, and functions.
Learn how to work with various data types and structures, including strings, lists, dictionaries, and tuples, enabling you to manipulate and analyze data effectively.
Develop Python Modules to Create Re-Usable Code.
Learn how to read from and write to files, enabling you to interact with external data sources and persist information across sessions.
You will learn Beautiful Soup, Request, Pandas, NumPy, Scikit Learn, and Matplotlib.
Absolutely no prior experience necessary.

description: Python is a versatile and powerful programming language known for its simplicity and readability. It is widely used in various domains such as web development, data analysis, artificial intelligence, scientific computing, and more. With its extensive standard library and active community support, Python is an excellent choice for both beginners and experienced developers.

contents.title: Decorators in Python

contents.description: Working with multiple processes using the multiprocessing module and multithreading concepts using the threading module.

contents: New to programming, seeking to learn their first language due to Python's simplicity and readability.
Programmers incorporating Python into web development, automation, or software projects.
Students and academics using Python in their curriculum or research.
Non-programmers (e.g., finance, marketing, engineering) automating tasks or conducting data analysis with Python
Integrate various data sources into Power BI and Tableau, including CSV files, SQL databases, and cloud storage services.
Understand relationships, cardinality, and schema types (Star and Snowflake) in Power BI data modeling.
Create dashboards in Power BI and Tableau to effectively communicate data insights through visual storytelling.
Use DAX functions in Power BI and calculated fields in Tableau for sophisticated data manipulation and insight generation.
Apply filtering and sorting techniques in Power BI and Tableau for focused and precise data exploration.
Gain skills in saving, sharing, and presenting data visualizations in professional formats using Power BI and Tableau.
No prior knowledge of data visualization required.
No programming skills required

description: Data visualization is the graphical representation of data to communicate insights and patterns effectively. By converting complex data into visual formats such as charts, graphs, and maps, data visualization allows for easier interpretation, analysis, and decision-making. It enables users to uncover trends, correlations, and outliers in data sets, making it an essential tool across various industries, including business, science, and academia.

contents.title: Introduction to Power BI
contents.description: Overview of tools, installation, data import, and understanding Direct Query vs. Import Data.

contents.title: Data Transformation
contents.description: Using Power Query Editor for data manipulation, including column adjustments, appending, merging queries, creating tables, and using query parameters.

contents.title: Modeling with Power BI
contents.description: Basics of data modeling, managing relationships, cardinality, cross-filtering, hierarchies, calculated columns, measures, and quick measures.

contents.title: Power BI Visualization
contents.description: Creating charts and visuals, applying formatting, filters, advanced techniques like drill down/up, managing visuals, and custom report themes.

contents.title: DAX Functions and Publishing
contents.description: Introduction to DAX, data types, operators, advanced DAX usage, function types, sharing, publishing reports, and using collaborative tools.

contents.title: Introduction to Tableau
contents.description: Overview of Tableau tools and interface, data connection, and preparation.

contents.title: Data Connections and Preparation
contents.description: Connecting to various data sources, blending data, managing extracts, and joining data.

contents.title: Data Transformation
contents.description: Tableau's data organization, applying filters, creating groups, and calculated fields.

contents.title: Visual Analytics
contents.description: Creating basic and advanced charts, geospatial visualization, trend lines, and reference lines.

contents.title: Dashboards and Stories
contents.description: Designing interactive dashboards, adding actions and filters, and creating compelling data stories.

contents.title: Sharing and Collaboration
contents.description: :Publishing to Tableau Server and Online, sharing workbooks, and using collaborative features.

contents: Programmers, researchers, designers, data scientists, journalists, and communication experts who need to present data effectively.
MS Excel users who have basic skills but want to master advanced charts, graphs & dashboard.
Anyone interested in understanding how graphs work and learning to identify misleading visualizations.
Professionals across industries aiming to enhance data analysis skills
Students in data science or business analytics fields seeking to expand their skills

Understanding the fundamental principles and methodologies of software testing.
Techniques for creating detailed test cases and documenting bug reports effectively.
Equivalence partitioning, boundary value analysis, decision table testing, and state transition testing.
How to use JIRA for project and issue tracking.
Statement coverage, decision coverage, condition coverage, path coverage, MCDC, loop coverage.
Introduction to API testing principles and how to use Postman for API testing.
Basics of performance testing using JMeter.
No prior knowledge about the field required.

courseDescription.title: Course Description
description: Software testing is the process of evaluating and verifying that a software application or system meets specified requirements and functions correctly. It involves various methods and techniques, such as manual and automated testing, unit testing, integration testing, system testing, and acceptance testing. The goal is to identify defects, ensure quality, and improve the performance, security, and usability of the software. Effective software testing is essential for delivering reliable and high-quality software products.

contents.title: Functional and Non-Functional Testing
contents.description: Different types of testing and their significance.

contents.title: Defect Management
contents.description: Creating and managing defect report sheets.

contents.title: Mobile Testing
contents.description: Using Appium for mobile application testing.

contents.title: API Testing
contents.description: Proficiency in API testing with Postman.

contents.title: Database Testing
contents.description: SQL skills for effective database testing.

contents.title: Core Selenium
contents.description: In-depth coverage of Selenium IDE, Grid, and WebDriver.

contents.title: Java Basics
contents.description: Essential Java programming knowledge for testers.

contents.title: Testing Frameworks
contents.description: Implementing TestNG, Maven, and generating Extent Reports.

contents.title: JIRA Tool
contents.description: Architecture, installation, project creation, user management, dashboard and gadgets customization, and exploring the Atlassian Marketplace.

contents.title: JMeter
contents.description: Introduction to JMeter elements, building test plans, recording tests, running multiple scripts, and using functions, variables, and regular expressions.

contents: People who want to begin a new career in software testing.
Individuals looking to learn software testing from scratch.
IT professionals who want to learn about software testing.
Software testers looking to deepen their understanding of software testing.

Understanding the fundamental principles and methodologies of digital marketing.
Techniques for creating detailed marketing strategies and documenting campaign performance effectively.
Search Engine Optimization (SEO), Pay-Per-Click (PPC) advertising, content marketing, and email marketing.
How to use Google Analytics for tracking and analyzing website traffic.
Social media marketing strategies across platforms like Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, and Twitter.
Introduction to influencer marketing principles and how to leverage influencers for brand promotion.
Basics of affiliate marketing and how to set up an affiliate program.
No prior knowledge about the field required
Basic computer & mobile using skills

description: Digital marketing is the process of promoting products or services through digital channels to reach and engage with a targeted audience. It involves various methods and techniques such as search engine optimization (SEO), social media marketing, content marketing, email marketing, and pay-per-click (PPC) advertising. The goal is to create effective online marketing strategies that increase brand awareness, drive website traffic, and generate leads and conversions. Effective digital marketing is essential for building a strong online presence and achieving business growth.

contents.title: Fundamentals of Digital Marketing
contents.description: Overview of digital marketing concepts and strategies.

contents.title: SEO and SEM
contents.description: Techniques for optimizing websites for search engines and managing search engine marketing campaigns.

contents.title: Content Marketing
contents.description: Creating and distributing valuable content to attract and engage your target audience.

contents.title: Social Media Marketing
contents.description: Leveraging social media platforms to promote your brand and interact with customers.

contents.title: Email Marketing
contents.description: Building and managing email lists, creating email campaigns, and analyzing their performance.

contents.title: Google Analytics
contents.description: Setting up and using Google Analytics to measure website performance and user behavior.

contents.title: PPC Advertising
contents.description: Understanding Google Ads, creating PPC campaigns, and optimizing for better ROI.

contents.title: Influencer Marketing
contents.description: Identifying and partnering with influencers to expand your reach and credibility.

contents.title: Affiliate Marketing
contents.description: Setting up and managing affiliate programs to drive sales through affiliate partnerships.

contents.title: E-commerce Marketing
contents.description: Strategies for promoting and selling products online.

contents.title: Mobile Marketing
contents.description: Techniques for reaching and engaging mobile users through apps and mobile-optimized websites.

contents: People who want to begin a new career in digital marketing.
Individuals looking to learn digital marketing from scratch.
Business owners and entrepreneurs who want to promote their businesses online.
Marketing professionals looking to deepen their understanding of digital marketing.
Building full-stack web applications with Angular and Node.js.
Understanding how Angular interacts with backend servers.
Connecting Angular frontend with Node.js backend.
Utilizing MongoDB with Mongoose for efficient data management.
Using ExpressJS to streamline server-side development.
Implementing optimistic updating for a better user experience.
Beginner-level knowledge of Angular is recommended, but the course provides detailed refreshers and explanations of core concepts.
No advanced or expert knowledge of any of these topics is required.

description: The MEAN stack is a full-stack JavaScript framework used for building dynamic web applications. It consists of MongoDB, a NoSQL database; Express.js, a web application framework for Node.js; Angular, a front-end JavaScript framework; and Node.js, a server-side JavaScript runtime environment. MEAN stack applications benefit from the flexibility of MongoDB for data storage, the simplicity of Express.js for server-side development, the power of Angular for creating dynamic user interfaces, and the scalability of Node.js for handling high loads. Together, these technologies provide a cohesive and efficient solution for developing modern, full-stack web applications.

contents.title: MongoDB, Express.js, Angular, Node.js
contents.description: Understand the roles and integration of each component in the MEAN stack to build full-stack JavaScript applications.

contents.title: Basics of NoSQL Databases
contents.description: Learn the fundamental concepts of NoSQL databases, highlighting the differences from traditional SQL databases.

contents.title: Data Modeling
contents.description: Understand how to design and manage data structures using collections and documents.

contents.title: CRUD Operations
contents.description: Perform Create, Read, Update, and Delete operations in MongoDB.

contents.title: Mongoose
contents.description: Learn how to use Mongoose, an ODM (Object Data Modeling) library, to interact with MongoDB in a Node.js application for schema definition, data validation, and query building.

contents.title: Installation and Setup
contents.description: Learn how to install Express.js and initialize a basic Express server to handle requests and responses.

contents.title: Middleware Functions
contents.description: Understand and use built-in, third-party, and custom middleware for tasks such as logging, parsing, and authentication.

contents.title: Routing
contents.description: Define and manage routes for handling different HTTP methods and endpoints, including nested and dynamic routes.

contents.title: CRUD Operations
contents.description: Create RESTful endpoints to handle Create, Read, Update, and Delete operations using HTTP methods (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE).

contents.title: JSON Data Handling
contents.description: Work with JSON data in API requests and responses, ensuring proper data.

contents.title: Error Handling
contents.description: Implement error-handling middleware to manage and log errors, and send appropriate error responses to clients.

contents.title: JWT-based Authentication
contents.description: Secure your application by setting up JSON Web Tokens (JWT) for user authentication and protecting routes, including implementing role-based access control.

contents.title: Building Components
contents.description: Create and manage Angular components.

contents.title: Data Binding
contents.description: Implement one-way and two-way data binding to synchronize data between the model and the view.

contents.title: Directives
contents.description: Utilize built-in and custom directives to manipulate DOM elements.

contents.title: Services
contents.description: Create and inject services for data sharing and business logic across components.

contents.title: Routing Configuration
contents.description: Set up and manage routes to navigate between different views and handle route parameters.

contents.title: Making HTTP Requests
contents.description: Use Angular's HttpClient to communicate with backend services.

contents.title: Observables
contents.description: Handle asynchronous data streams with RxJS observables.

contents.title: Form Handling
contents.description: Implement template-driven and reactive forms.

contents.title: Validation
contents.description: Apply form validation techniques to ensure data integrity.

contents.title: Overview
contents.description: Understand the fundamentals of Node.js and its use for server-side programming.

contents.title: Event Loop
contents.description: Learn about the event-driven, non-blocking I/O model of Node.js.

contents.title: Modules
contents.description: Explore core and third-party modules.

contents.title: npm
contents.description: Manage dependencies using npm (Node Package Manager).

contents.title: Callbacks, Promises, and Async/Await
contents.description: Handle asynchronous operations efficiently.

contents: Individuals interested in applying their existing Angular and NodeJS knowledge.
Those with a basic understanding of Angular and NodeJS who want a detailed guide on connecting both technologies.
Anyone interested in building modern, full-stack applications.
Students looking to practice and enhance their skills in NodeJS and Angular.
Those seeking to develop a complete full-stack project.
Anyone interested in learning development with Angular, TypeScript, and Socket IO.
Individuals looking to improve their knowledge of web development.
Understand how to integrate the frontend (ReactJS) with the backend (NodeJS, Express) and database (MongoDB).
Gain hands-on experience by creating a complete fullstack application.
Reinforce your knowledge of ReactJS, NodeJS, Express, and MongoDB before diving into complex topics.
Learn to secure your applications by adding user authentication (signup, login) and authorization to control access to resources.
Integrate file upload capabilities in your ReactJS and Node/Express applications.
Learners should have a fundamental understanding of JavaScript, including variables, functions, and basic syntax.
A basic grasp of web development concepts such as HTML, CSS, and web architecture will be helpful.

description: The MERN stack, comprising MongoDB, Express.js, React.js, and Node.js, is a powerful combination of technologies for building modern web applications. MongoDB, a NoSQL database, provides flexibility and scalability for data storage. Express.js is a minimalist web framework for Node.js, enabling efficient server-side development and API creation. React.js, a front-end library offers a component-based approach for building interactive user interfaces. Node.js serves as the runtime environment for server-side JavaScript execution, facilitating seamless communication between the front and back ends.

contents.title: Basics of NoSQL Databases
contents.description: Introduction to MongoDB as a flexible and scalable NoSQL database solution.

contents.title: CRUD Operations
contents.description: Learn to perform Create, Read, Update, and Delete operations on MongoDB documents.

contents.title: Data Modeling
contents.description: Understand the concept of collections and documents and design efficient data models.

contents.title: Mongoose Integration
contents.description: Use Mongoose, an ODM (Object Data Modeling) library, to interact with MongoDB in Node.js applications.

contents.title: Setting up Express.js
contents.description: Initialize and configure Express.js to create a web server for handling HTTP requests.

contents.title: Middleware
contents.description: Implement middleware for handling request/response pipelines and enhancing functionality.

contents.title: Routing
contents.description: Define routes to handle different endpoints and HTTP methods.

contents.title: Building APIs
contents.description: Use Express.js to create RESTful APIs for communication between the client and server.

contents.title: Introduction to React.js
contents.description: Understand the fundamentals of React.js, including components, JSX syntax, and state management.

contents.title: Component-based Architecture
contents.description: Learn to build reusable and modular UI components for building dynamic user interfaces.

contents.title: State Management
contents.description: Implement state management techniques using React's built-in state and props system.

contents.title: React Hooks
contents.description: Explore React Hooks for managing stateful logic and side effects in functional components.

contents.title: Introduction to Node.js
contents.description: Overview of Node.js as a runtime environment for server-side JavaScript execution.

contents.title: Event-driven Architecture
contents.description: Understand the event-driven, non-blocking I/O model of Node.js.

contents.title: Node.js Modules
contents.description: Explore core and third-party modules for building scalable and efficient server-side applications.

contents.title: Asynchronous Programming
contents.description: Learn asynchronous programming patterns using callbacks, promises, and async/await.

contents: Developers who are familiar with React and Express Fundamentals and now want to learn how to build and deploy MERN application from scratch.
Developers aiming to expand their toolkit with authentication, Redux, and advanced MongoDB usage.
Fundamental concepts of cloud computing designed for absolute beginners.
Basics of Amazon Web Services (AWS), the leading cloud computing platform.
Understanding of fundamental cloud systems including storage, networking, and compute.
Hands-on skills using core Amazon Web Services (AWS) services.
Absolutely no prior experience necessary.
No IT prerequisites required

description: Cloud computing is a revolutionary technology that allows users to access and store data and applications over the internet instead of on local servers or personal devices. By leveraging remote servers hosted on the internet, cloud computing provides scalable and flexible resources on-demand, enabling businesses and individuals to efficiently manage and utilize computing resources without the need for extensive infrastructure investments.

contents.title: Amazon Web Services Fundamentals
contents.description: Introduction to AWS, its services, and core concepts.

contents.title: AWS Authentication and Access Control
contents.description: Understanding authentication mechanisms and access control methods in AWS.

contents.title: Amazon EC2, Auto Scaling, and Load Balancing
contents.description: Exploring Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2), auto-scaling configurations, and load balancing techniques for scalability and high availability.

contents.title: Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (VPC)
contents.description: Overview of AWS Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) for networking isolation and security.

contents.title: AWS Storage Services
contents.description: Learning about various AWS storage services such as Amazon S3, EBS, and Glacier for data storage and retrieval.

contents.title: AWS Database Services
contents.description: Introduction to AWS database services including Amazon RDS, DynamoDB, and Redshift for managing structured and unstructured data.

contents.title: Automation and DevOps on AWS
contents.description: Implementing automation and DevOps practices using AWS services like CloudFormation, OpsWorks, and CodeDeploy.

contents.title: DNS, Caching, and Performance Optimization
contents.description: Understanding Domain Name System (DNS), caching mechanisms, and performance optimization techniques on AWS.

contents.title: Containers and Serverless Computing
contents.description: Exploring containerization with AWS ECS, EKS, and serverless computing using AWS Lambda for efficient resource utilization.

contents: Anyone keen to learn about cloud computing.
Professionals exploring cloud computing services.
Individuals interested in understanding Amazon Web Services (AWS).
Aspiring developers wanting to build applications on AWS.
Students keen to learn fundamental cloud computing concepts
Understand the correct syntax of Python language elements like indentation, loops, conditionals, and functions.
Learn how to work with various data types and structures, including strings, lists, dictionaries, and tuples, enabling you to manipulate and analyze data effectively.
Develop Python Modules to Create Re-Usable Code.
Learn how to read from and write to files, enabling you to interact with external data sources and persist information across sessions.
You will learn Beautiful Soup, Request, Pandas, NumPy, Scikit Learn, and Matplotlib.
Absolutely no prior experience necessary.

description: Python is a versatile and powerful programming language known for its simplicity and readability. It is widely used in various domains such as web development, data analysis, artificial intelligence, scientific computing, and more. With its extensive standard library and active community support, Python is an excellent choice for both beginners and experienced developers.

contents.title: Overview of Python
contents.description: Introduction to Python, its features, and how it works internally.

contents.title: Variables and Keywords
contents.description: Understanding variables, naming conventions, and Python keywords.

contents.title: Python Data Types
contents.description: Exploring built-in data types like numeric, string, list, tuple, dictionary, and set.

contents.title: Operators and their Types
contents.description: Overview of operators in Python including arithmetic, comparison, logical, and bitwise.

contents.title: Control Flow
contents.description: Conditional statements (if, elif) for decision-making, and loops (for loop, while loop) for iteration.

contents.title: Functions
contents.description: Introduction to defining and calling functions, function arguments, inner calling techniques, and lambda functions.

contents.title: Recursion Function
contents.description: Understanding recursion and implementing recursive functions.

contents.title: Dynamic Input in Lists
contents.description: Handling dynamic input in lists using list comprehension and input() function.

contents.title: Object-Oriented Programming
contents.description: Introduction to OOP concepts like classes, objects, inheritance, polymorphism, and encapsulation.

contents.title: Decorators in Python
contents.description: Understanding decorators to add functionality to functions and methods.

contents.title: Multiprocessing and Multithreading
contents.description: Working with multiple processes using the multiprocessing module and multithreading concepts using the threading module.

contents.title: File Handling
contents.description: Reading from and writing to files in Python.

contents.title: Modules and Packages
contents.description: Understanding modules and packages for code organization and reuse

contents.title: Automation
contents.description: Automating tasks using scripting and scheduling.

contents: New to programming, seeking to learn their first language due to Python's simplicity and readability.
Programmers incorporating Python into web development, automation, or software projects.
Students and academics using Python in their curriculum or research.
Non-programmers (e.g., finance, marketing, engineering) automating tasks or conducting data analysis with Python

Understand fundamental syntax and concepts of the C programming language, including variables, data types, operators, control structures (loops and conditionals), functions, and basic I/O operations.
Learn how to write high-quality code.
Understanding how memory is managed in C and mastering the use of pointers is crucial.
Understand memory management and pointers to utilize memory efficiently and prevent errors.
Learn basics like variables, data types, operators, control structures, functions, and basic I/O operations.
Develop skills for clean, readable, and maintainable code following best practices.
Understand memory management and pointers to utilize memory efficiently and prevent errors.
Structure code into reusable functions and modules for better readability, maintainability, and scalability.
No programming experience, all concepts taught in this class!

description: C is a powerful and versatile programming language renowned for its efficiency, flexibility, and portability. Originally developed in the early 1970s, C has since become one of the most widely used programming languages, influencing the design of numerous other languages. Its syntax is concise and expressive, allowing for efficient manipulation of low-level system resources while also providing high-level constructs for structured programming.

contents.title: Introduction and First Program
contents.description: Covers the history of C language and introduces the basic program, which is typically the first program learners write in any language.

contents.title: Variables and Data Types
contents.description: Explains identifiers, variables, data types, and constants in C programming.

contents.title: Operators and Expressions
contents.description: Discusses arithmetic, relational, logical, and bitwise operators, along with expressions.

contents.title: Control Flow Statements
contents.description: Various control flow statements like if, switch, loops (while, do-while, for), as well as special cases, break, and continue statements.

contents.title: Working with Functions
contents.description: Introduces functions, scope of variables, storage classes, pass-by value/reference, and recursion.

contents.title: Working with Arrays
contents.description: Discusses arrays, their declaration, initialization, usage in functions, and multi-dimensional arrays.

contents.title: Pointers
contents.description: Focuses on pointers, including their usage as function parameters, pointer arithmetic, relationship with arrays, and function pointers.

contents.title: File Handling
contents.description: Introduces file streams, writing and reading characters, text and binary file handling, and structure serialization.

contents.title: String Handling
contents.description: Explores string manipulation functions and operations in C.

contents.title: Structures and Unions
contents.description: Introduces structured data types, their declaration, initialization, and usage.

contents.title: Command Line Arguments
contents.description: Discusses how to work with command-line arguments passed to C programs.

contents: Anyone looking to learn how to program in the C language
Understand the correct syntax of Python language elements like indentation, loops, conditionals, and functions.
Learn how to work with various data types and structures, including strings, lists, dictionaries, and tuples, enabling you to manipulate and analyze data effectively.
Develop Python Modules to Create Re-Usable Code.
Learn how to read from and write to files, enabling you to interact with external data sources and persist information across sessions.
You will learn Beautiful Soup, Request, Pandas, NumPy, Scikit Learn, and Matplotlib.
Absolutely no prior experience necessary.

contents.title: Decorators in Python
contents.description: Understanding decorators to add functionality to functions and methods.

contents.title: Multiprocessing and Multithreading
contents.description: Working with multiple processes using the multiprocessing module and multithreading concepts using the threading module.

contents.title: File Handling
contents.description: Reading from and writing to files in Python.

contents.title: Modules and Packages
contents.description: Understanding modules and packages for code organization and reuse

contents.title: Automation
contents.description: Automating tasks using scripting and scheduling.

contents: New to programming, seeking to learn their first language due to Python's simplicity and readability.
Programmers incorporating Python into web development, automation, or software projects.
Students and academics using Python in their curriculum or research.
Non-programmers (e.g., finance, marketing, engineering) automating tasks or conducting data analysis with Python
Understand the correct syntax of Python language elements like indentation, loops, conditionals, and functions.
Learn how to work with various data types and structures, including strings, lists, dictionaries, and tuples, enabling you to manipulate and analyze data effectively.
Develop Python Modules to Create Re-Usable Code.
Learn how to read from and write to files, enabling you to interact with external data sources and persist information across sessions.
You will learn Beautiful Soup, Request, Pandas, NumPy, Scikit Learn, and Matplotlib.
Absolutely no prior experience necessary.

description: Python is a versatile and powerful programming language known for its simplicity and readability. It is widely used in various domains such as web development, data analysis, artificial intelligence, scientific computing, and more. With its extensive standard library and active community support, Python is an excellent choice for both beginners and experienced developers.

contents.title: Overview of Python
contents.description: Introduction to Python, its features, and how it works internally.

contents.title: Variables and Keywords
contents.description: Understanding variables, naming conventions, and Python keywords.

contents.title: Python Data Types
contents.description: Exploring built-in data types like numeric, string, list, tuple, dictionary, and set.

contents.title: Operators and their Types
contents.description: Overview of operators in Python including arithmetic, comparison, logical, and bitwise.

contents.title: Control Flow
contents.description: Conditional statements (if, elif) for decision-making, and loops (for loop, while loop) for iteration.

contents.title: Functions
contents.description: Introduction to defining and calling functions, function arguments, inner calling techniques, and lambda functions.

contents.title: Recursion Function
contents.description: Understanding recursion and implementing recursive functions.

contents.title: Dynamic Input in Lists
contents.description: Handling dynamic input in lists using list comprehension and input() function.

contents.title: Object-Oriented Programming
contents.description: Introduction to OOP concepts like classes, objects, inheritance, polymorphism, and encapsulation.

contents.title: Decorators in Python
contents.description: Understanding decorators to add functionality to functions and methods.

contents.description: Working with multiple processes using the multiprocessing module and multithreading concepts using the threading module.

aboutPage.heading1: Knowledge is power, Information is liberating
description: Hematite Infotech Pvt. Ltd. is an organization dedicated to the spread of IT Education. Ever since its inception in 2017, the Academy has fulfilled its goals of providing Quality Computer Education, transforming aspiring students into tomorrowâ€™s IT professionals. Hematite Infotech has continuously upgraded its performance, creating a focus on advanced information technologies, high-end academics, and training.

The center has modern infrastructure, including corporate-standard laboratories equipped with the latest state-of-the-art technologies. We are proud to remain associated with the best faculty in the industry. Besides lectures from experts and visiting faculty, we also organize video-based sessions, seminars, assignments, internships, projects, faculty-student discussions, expert talks and profiling of the students, guidance in hackathons, Start-ups, etc. We also have a well-equipped library with a wide array of manuals. We also provide placement assistance to our students. Hematite Infotech has had an enviable placement record since its inception.
